definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: You seem to turn some light.
He must be permitted to speak of that Paris as though it still existed.
sentences.chinese: 请允许他谈那旧时的巴黎，好象它现在仍然存在一样。

sentences.english: Daisy took her face in her hands as if feeling its lovely shape.
sentences.chinese: 黛西把她的脸埋在手中，好象在感觉那娇好的轮廓。

sentences.english: You seem mistrusted even of your friends.
It was like a shower of roses falling athwart this house of mourning.
sentences.chinese: 那好象是阵荡涤悲哀的玫瑰雨。

sentences.english: My emotions went up and down the scale like a yo-yo.
sentences.chinese: 当时我的情绪就好象悠悠轮一样忽上忽下。

sentences.english: I study the way it seems a bit bitter ?
sentences.chinese: 我的求学之路好象有点苦呢？

sentences.english: Sometimes he bent his head, as if under a great weight of sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 有时候他低着头，好象满怀愁情。

sentences.english: Women, it seems, enjoy singledom more than men do.
sentences.chinese: 妇女好象比男人更会享受单身生活。

sentences.english: Her mind seemed to be wandering, and she didn't recognize me.
sentences.chinese: 她好象精神恍惚，没认出我来。

sentences.english: It was like the tinkling of a bell.
sentences.chinese: 好象是个受到振动的铃铛。

sentences.english: Are all, as seems to suit thee best, Thy appellations.
sentences.chinese: 这些是给你的名称，好象对你全都挺适用。

sentences.english: The children seem particularly chirpy today.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们今天好象特别快活。

sentences.english: He frightens keep cringing , saw ghost similar for the good elephant.
sentences.chinese: 他吓得直哆嗦，就好象看到了鬼一样。

sentences.english: It sounded like someone just snapped a twig right behind me.
sentences.chinese: 好象是有人在我背后折断了一根小树枝。

sentences.english: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine in your home.
sentences.chinese: 你妻子在你的内室，好象多结果子的葡萄树。

definition: seems as if/rather like/Taiwan pr. [si4 de5]
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
can it be possible that/could it be
